summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Alaska Airlines, dated January 23, 2020, commanding the airline to produce records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and two other individuals (names redacted) for specified time periods. The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into alleged violations including sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena to Alaska Airlines as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as an individual for whom Alaska Airlines is commanded to produce all records, including passenger, payment, and membership records, for the periods January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019 through the date of service.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Alaska Airlines to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York at the United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, in New York City, to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal criminal law.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued to Alaska Airlines by the U.S. Attorney's Office, initiating a formal demand for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and others as part of a criminal investigation.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Alaska Airlines, 19300 International Blvd, Seattle, WA
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement of minors), and 371 (conspiracy).

Alaska Airlines is commanded to produce all records for Ghislaine Maxwell (also known as Ghislaine Borgerson) for two time periods: January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019 through the date of service (January 23, 2020).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests that Alaska Airlines voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena lists two additional individuals (names and dates of birth redacted in the provided text) for whom records are also requested.
The document indicates the investigation was active and ongoing as of January 2020, targeting potential evidence of sex trafficking and related offenses involving air travel.
